title: Increases the penalties imposed upon gas and electric utilities for failure to file or correct an annual report with the public service commission
summary: Increases the penalties imposed upon gas and electric utilities for failure to file or correct an annual report with the public service commission; such penalties shall not be more than 1% of the utilities' annual net revenue for each day of violation, but not to exceed $25,000 nor be less than $100.

       AN ACT to amend the public service law, in relation to penalties for the

       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision 6 of section 66 of the public service law, as
    2  amended by chapter 784 of the laws  of  1923,  is  amended  to  read  as

    5  shall be the duty of every such person and corporation to file with  the
    6  commission  an  annual  report,  verified  by the oath of the president,

    9  tion shall be made by said official holding office at the  time  of  the
   10  filing  of said report, and if not made upon the knowledge of the person
   11  verifying the same shall set forth the sources of  his  information  and
   12  the  grounds  of  his belief as to any matters not stated to be verified
   13  upon his knowledge. The report shall show in detail (a)  the  amount  of
   14  its authorized capital stock and the amount thereof issued and outstand-
   15  ing; (b) the amount of its authorized bonded indebtedness and the amount
   16  of  its  bonds  and  other  forms of evidence of indebtedness issued and
   17  outstanding; (c) its receipts  and  expenditures  during  the  preceding
   18  year;  (d)  the  amount paid as dividends upon its stock and as interest
   19  upon its bonds; (e) the names of its officers and the  aggregate  amount
   20  paid  as salaries to them and the amount paid as wages to its employees;
   21  (f) the location of  its  plant  or  plants  and  system,  with  a  full
   22  description  of  its property and franchises, stating in detail how each
   23  franchise stated to be owned was acquired;  and  (g)  such  other  facts
   24  pertaining to the operation and maintenance of the plant and system, and

    1  the  affairs  of  such  person  or corporation as may be required by the
    2  commission. Such reports shall be in the form, cover the period  and  be
    3  filed at the time prescribed by the commission. The commission may, from
    4  time  to  time,  make changes and additions in such forms. When any such
    5  report is defective or believed to be erroneous,  the  commission  shall
    6  notify  the  person,  corporation  or municipality making such report to
    7  amend the same within a time prescribed  by  the  commission.  Any  such
    8  person  or  corporation  or municipality which shall neglect to make any
    9  such report or which shall fail to correct any such  report  within  the
   10  time  prescribed  by  the commission shall be liable to a penalty of NOT
   11  MORE THAN ONE-TENTH OF ONE PERCENT OF THE ANNUAL NET  REVENUES  OF  SUCH
   12  PERSON, CORPORATION OR MUNICIPALITY FOR THE PAST YEAR, BUT NOT MORE THAN
   13  TWENTY-FIVE  THOUSAND  DOLLARS  NOR LESS THAN one hundred dollars and an
   14  additional penalty of [one hundred  dollars]  NOT  MORE  THAN  THE  SAME
   15  AMOUNT for each day after the prescribed time for which it shall neglect
   16  to file or correct the same, to be sued for in the name of the people of
   17  the  state of New York. The amount recovered in any such action shall be
   18  paid into the state treasury and be credited to the  general  fund.  The
   19  commission may extend the time prescribed for cause shown.
   20    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   21  it shall have become a law. Provided, that the public service commission

   23  including but not limited to the promulgation of  any  necessary  rules,
